summary:
Michiel Walsteijn is General Manager at TSS. TSS is part of CSI; a Vertical Market Software company aimed at core business applications in various industries. Currently, he is responsible for 9 business units within TSS and active with M&A in Portugal, Greece and other Balkan countries.

He has 36 years of experience in the industry, of which 6 years at TSS, 4 years at Edifecs, 19 years at Oracle and 7 at Capgemini. He has a proven track record for the creation and build-out of vertical business units for Oracle, Edifecs and TSS; both in a local and in a global setting.
   
Michiel has a broad experience in General Management, Sales, Product Strategy and Product Management, Development and Consulting. He is highly results oriented, aimed at profitable revenue growth while achieving customer success. Michiel combines business knowledge with a thorough understanding of technology.  

Developed and managed cross-cultural on-/off-/near-shore teams to deliver solutions to meet customer requirements and being focused on building motivated teams.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for 9 business units within TSS, of which 7 in the Netherlands and 2 in Portugal. Active with M&A in Portugal, Greece and other Balkan countries. TSS is part of Topicus.com, which is a subsidiary of CSI (Constellation Software, Inc.). 

CSI was founded in 1995 to assemble a portfolio of vertical market software companies that have the potential to be leaders in their particular market. Since then, we have grown rapidly through a combination of acquisitions and organic growth, and established a strong constellation of companies with a large, diverse customer base comprised of over 125,000 customers operating in over 100 countries around the world.

With our headquarters in Toronto, Canada, and offices in North America, Europe, Australia, South America and Africa, we have over 1000 business units generating consolidated revenues exceeding US$6.5 billion.
profile_positions.title: General Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a General Manager within TSS responsible for 8 business units. As a Managing Director responsible for PinkRoccade Mental Care; a Vertical Market Software company aimed at the product management, development, sales, consulting services and support of core clinical applications for Mental Care institutions in the Netherlands. 

The 8 business units are part of TSS/Topicus.com, which is a subsidiary of CSI (Constellation Software, Inc.).
profile_positions.title: General Manager TSS and Managing Director PinkRoccade GGZ (Mental Care)

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the international markets at Edifecs, with market focus on The Netherlands, Middle East and Africa.

Product focus on several Edifecs value propositions: Configurable Healthcare Data Interchange, Value Based Healthcare (fee for value as opposed to fee for service), Enterprise Testing & Compliance, Claims Denial Management and Clinical Data Repositories. Edifecs is the US market leader related to specific Healthcare IT markets.

Started the International unit from scratch and has been able to lead Edifecs to be a market leader in the United Arab Emirates (largest health insurer Daman, with presence in Abu Dhabi and Dubai) and to have substantial presence in the Dutch market as well. Partnered with for instance inHealth in the UAE and Truston in the Netherlands.

Lighthouse customers in the Netherlands: Vektis (the standards setting body in the Netherlands for communication between healthcare payers and providers), ONVZ (mid-size healthcare payer with highest customer satisfaction in the Netherlands) and IAK (broker/TPA for healthcare payers).
profile_positions.title: Executive Vice President International

profile_positions.description:
During his entire Oracle tenure Michiel has been in the Health Insurance industry in many different roles; e.g. Designer/Developer, Development Manager, Implementation Manager, Sales Representative and General Manager of the Oracle Health Insurance unit. 

Michiel co-founded this unit within Oracle Netherlands in 1996 and became head of the unit in 2000 and was promoted to Vice President. Sustainable revenue growth with consistent high, double digit margin every year. Grew the unit from 20 to 160 associates in a 10-year period, in a sound onshore/offshore mix.
 
The focus of the unit were the core Health Insurance applications such as Claims Processing, Member Administration, Product Definition, Provider Contracts and related Business Intelligence.

After growing the unit to be the market leader in the Netherlands with a 45% market share, Oracle Health Insurance became a European practice in 2007 and was transferred to Global level in 2010; part of an Oracle Global Business Unit. 

OHI entered the US market in 2010 with a large deal at Harvard Pilgrim Health Care in the Boston area; the number one health insurer in US from a quality perspective. Won against 8 existing competitors, including the market leader in US and their incumbent vendor. Partnered with Dell Services (former Perot team).

In 2012 the Brazilian market was entered with a large deal at Qualicorp, the leading broker/TPA in Sao Paulo. Partnered with Accenture, who was the prime contractor.

Initiated and established co-developments with both Harvard Pilgrim Health Care (HPHC) and Cigna. HPHC had been the number one US payer in terms of quality for 8 consecutive years. Cigna is a top 5 health insurer in US from a size perspective. This lead to the development of OHI Components based on the newest Oracle cloud technologies. 

Today OHI is Oracle’s global solution for Health Insurance across Europe, US, South America, Middle East, Africa and Australia.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Oracle Health Insurance

profile_positions.description:
IT Consultant at various mission critical projects of Capgemini. Hired by the acquired company Volmac; the leading Dutch System Integrator at the time. 

The largest project was at PNEM, implementing a core application for utilities. Became the functional expert of this application, leading the acceptance test team on the business side and trained 26 groups of end-users varying from senior management to deep domain experts. 

R&D project at VSR (Vleermuis Software Research); conceptualizing, designing and realization of Custom Database Publishing. The concept was to author documents only once and to publish in a customized way; customized to characteristics of the target reader and/or target groups. Developed extensive knowledge of SGML (predecessor of XML).

The last couple of years were at Rank Xerox, implementing Oracle Financials and Manufacturing. Realized custom development of QA functions related to the manufacturing process, as that capability was missing in the Oracle applications at the time.
profile_positions.title: IT Consultant
